body_html:
Unfortunately, how to get other packages such as matplotlib to work in specific environments is not our area of expertise and not something that we can debug in the TensorFlow project.

That said, just going off the error message you pointed to above, have you looked at "Working with Matplotlib in Virtual environments" in the Matplotlib FAQ.

Perhaps you can get advice on stackoverflow or on the Matplotlib project. You may also find this link: http://matplotlib.org/faq/installing_faq.html#which-python-for-os-x interesting.

Hope you find a solution, best of luck!

body:
Unfortunately, how to get other packages such as matplotlib to work in specific environments is not our area of expertise and not something that we can debug in the TensorFlow project.

That said, just going off the error message you pointed to above, have you looked at ["Working with Matplotlib in Virtual environments"](http://matplotlib.org/faq/virtualenv_faq.html) in the Matplotlib FAQ.

Perhaps you can get advice on stackoverflow or on the Matplotlib project. You may also find this link: http://matplotlib.org/faq/installing_faq.html#which-python-for-os-x interesting.

Hope you find a solution, best of luck!
